pullRequest.body:
We define the Veblen function `veblen a b`, so that `veblen 0 a = ω ^ a` and `veblen x` enumerates the common fixed points of `veblen y` for `y < x`. We then prove some basic properties.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

Split from #17802.

`+ veblenWith_lt_veblenWith_right_iff`

`+ veblenWith_pos`

`+ veblenWith_veblenWith_of_lt`

`+ veblenWith_zero_lt_iff`

`+ veblen_le_veblen_right_iff`

`+ veblen_lt_veblen_right_iff`

`+ veblen_succ`

<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
(oops, I wrote these two weeks ago and forgot to hit submit; hopefully they still make sense. Please let me know if I can clarify anything!)

```suggestion
- `veblenWith f a` enumerates the common fixed points of `veblenWith f b` for `b < a` when `a ≠ 0`.
```
The usual mathlib pattern would be to give `veblenWith_right_strictMono`, since the others are all simple applications of this one
This makes the code longer in a few places, but it does reduce duplication, so I'll take it.

```suggestion
    Monotone (veblenWith f · o) := by
```
if you'd like!

```suggestion
theorem derivFamily_strictMono [Small.{u} ι] :
    StrictMono (derivFamily f) := (Ordinal.isNormal_derivFamily f).strictMono
```

Consider this, although it isn't truly important
```suggestion
@[pp_nodot]
def veblenWith (f : Ordinal.{u} → Ordinal.{u}) (o : Ordinal.{u}) : Ordinal.{u} → Ordinal.{u} :=
  if o = 0 then f else derivFamily fun (⟨x, _⟩ : Set.Iio o) ↦ veblenWith f x
termination_by o
```
Perhaps `hf : IsNormal f` could be a `variable` here (you'd have to use `include`, I think). This could also be in the `IsNormal` namespace to allow dot notation on `hf`

I agree that having this variable makes the code cleaner. However, I feel like having `IsNormal.veblen` and `veblen`, or even `IsNormal.veblenWith` and `veblen`, would be somewhat confusing. So I think it's fine having these theorems without dot notation.
Perhaps this should be a `section`, then?
That's what I did :)
I meant only for the `IsNormal` part, but I guess it doesn't matter
Could you add an `injective` version of this, with conclusion `Function.Injective (veblenWith f o)`?
Could you add an `injective` version of this, with conclusion `Function.Injective (veblen o)`?
I find these theorems a bit hard to read. Could you add docstrings for them, describing the conclusion in words?

These theorems characterize precisely when `veblen a b` is less, less-equal, or equal to `veblen c d`. They are useful in defining the Veblen form ordinal notation, where they're used to define comparison.

I've added docstrings for these theorems which should make their statements more readable.
I find these theorems a bit hard to read. Could you add docstrings for them, describing the conclusion in words?

```suggestion
theorem veblenWith_right_strictMono (o : Ordinal) : StrictMono (veblenWith f o) :=
  isNormal_veblenWith.strictMono
```
or something similar should work here

```suggestion
theorem IsNormal.veblenWith (o : Ordinal) : IsNormal (veblenWith f o) := by
```
since you have `hf` included already
Here, and below, the name should be `veblenWith_lt_veblenWith_iff_right`, eg similar to `pow_le_pow_iff_right`.
Here, let's use the name `veblenWith_zero_lt_veblenWith_zero_iff_left`
Just to be sure, why does something like this fail with the final argument something other than zero?
Actually, doesn't `veblenWith_lt_veblenWith_iff` show something quite a bit stronger?
In general the function is only monotone. For example if `x = veblen 2 0` then `veblen 0 x = veblen 1 x = x`.

```suggestion
theorem veblenWith_lt_veblenWith_iff : 
    veblenWith f a b < veblenWith f c d ↔
    (a = c ∧ b < d) ∨ (a < c ∧ b < veblenWith f c d) ∨ (c < a ∧ veblenWith f a b < d) := by
```
optional, but I think this makes the statement quite a bit more readable
can't you just inline this as `(by simp)` where you use it?
this one also looks inlinable

pullRequest.title: feat(SetTheory/Ordinal/Veblen): the two-argument Veblen function
